title: MT69011: Powder Metallurgy Lab.I - Quick Facts
text:
MT69011
Course name | POWDER METALLURGY LAB.I
Offered by | Metallurgical & Materials Engineering
Credits | 2
L-T-P | 0-0-3
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | {{{semester}}}

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: 1.Characterization of powders (Sieve analysis, apparent and tap density, flow rate measurement, hydrogen loss test, SEM of powder and image analysis) â 2 labs2.XRD and BET surface area analysis of ultrafine/nano powders (crystallite size, strain, surface area measurement and phase identification) â 2 labs3.Compaction of powders (density gradient as a function of height, weight and compaction pressure) â 2 labs4.Conventional sintering of powder compacts â 1 lab5.Non conventional sintering technique (microwave sintering) â 1 lab6.Reaction synthesis of different ceramic powders and whiskers (Borides, nitride, carbide, silicides, etc) â 2 labs
